most_active_tickets.title: [Bug] Workstream summaries broken >1 week & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint

common_issues.title: Workstream summaries broken & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint
common_issues.description: PiecesOS v12.1.0 and Desktop v4.3.1 on Linux Mint 22.1: (1) Workstream summaries stopped generating after July 9, 2025. Manual rollup fails. (2) Ollama is installed and running, but Pieces Desktop doesn't detect it. User confirmed Ollama path, service status, and Pieces updates. Logs only present up to July 9. Issue persists for >1 week.

related_issues.title: [Bug] Workstream summaries broken >1 week & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint
related_issues.text:
[Bug] Workstream summaries broken >1 week & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Describe the bug**  
1. No new workstream summaries have been generated since mid‑July 2025. Manual roll‑up always fails with “unable to find any workstream events.”  
2. Pieces Desktop reports “Ollama needs to be installed” even though `ollama` is in `$PATH` and the service is running on `127.0.0.1:11434`.

---

**To Reproduce**  
1. **Environment**  
   - OS: Linux Mint 22.1 “Cinnamon” (X11) (64‑bit)  
   - Kernel: 6.8.0‑62‑generic
   - PiecesOS v12.1.0 (snap)
   - Pieces Desktop: v4.3.1
   - Ollama CLI: `/usr/local/bin/ollama` (installed via official script)  
   - Ollama service: running (`ollama serve` → `Error: bind: address already in use`; confirmed via browser at http://127.0.0.1:11434)

2. **Workstream summary failure**  
   - Open Pieces Desktop → Workstream Activity  
   - Observe events up through July 9, 2025, but no events or summaries for July 10–13.  
   - Click “Generate manual Workstream Rollup” for any time window → error:  
     ```
     unable to find any workstream events
     ```

3. **Ollama detection failure**  
   - Verify in terminal:  
     ```bash
     which ollama
     → /usr/local/bin/ollama

     ollama list
     → (lists available models)

     curl http://127.0.0.1:11434
     → “Ollama is running”
     ```  
   - In Pieces Desktop, attempt to enable “Local Models” → receives error “Ollama needs to be installed.”

---

**Expected behavior**  
- Workstream summaries continue to be generated daily (or allow manual roll‑ups to succeed).  
- Pieces Desktop auto‑detects my installed Ollama CLI + service and lists local models.

---

**Screenshots & Logs**  
- **Pieces log directory**: `~/.local/share/com.pieces.os.dependency_management/` shows logs only up to July 9.
- **No error messages** appear in those dependency logs.  

---

**Additional context**  
- I’ve already:  
  - Verified `snap refresh` and `apt update && apt upgrade` to ensure latest PiecesOS and Desktop.  
  - Stopped/restarted any existing Ollama service (killed port 11434, rebooted, then `ollama serve`).  
  - Manually pointed Pieces Desktop at `/usr/local/bin/ollama` and `http://127.0.0.1:11434` in settings, then fully quit & relaunched the app.  
- Issue has persisted for >1 week.

Please let me know what additional details I can provide to help debug. Thank you!  

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate the root cause of workstream summaries failing to generate after July 9, 2025.
Address the issue of Pieces Desktop not detecting a running Ollama instance on Linux Mint.
Prioritize resolution of bug report #798: '[Bug] Workstream summaries broken >1 week & Ollama not detected on Linux Mint'.
Review and update Pieces Desktop's Ollama detection logic.
Improve logging in PiecesOS and Desktop to capture errors beyond July 9 and provide more context for debugging.
